announcement.title: First lecture + Socrative
announcement.content:
Dear Madam, dear Sir,

As you probably know, the first lecture of the information security course starts on Monday, February 12 at 13:00 in auditorium 1 (iGent, Tech Lane Ghent Science Park - Campus A).

The class schedule for this course is:

  • Monday, from 13:00 to 14:15 (auditorium 1, iGent)
  • Tuesday, from 8:30 (I know, it's early) to 11:15 (auditorium 1, iGent)

Some of the lectures will be exercises, but this will be announced during one of the previous lectures and on minerva. Finally, 2 or 3 lab sessions are scheduled for this course, typically in April and May, on afternoon and evening sessions (to be scheduled later on).

I intend to use "Socrative" (https://www.socrative.com/) during this course. For those not yet familiar with this software, it is a tool allowing to answer questions (multiple-choice and other) using a smart phone, a tablet, or some other computer with the required connectivity (somewhat similar to the Turning Point voting system, but without the voting devices). You can install the "Socrative Student" app (available on Google Play, iTunes, and even Windows Store), but you can also simply browse the page https://b.socrative.com/login/student/  (this also works on laptops, tablets, and smart phones). The teacher's room name to be entered is 2197150d . So, for once, I'd even encourage you to use your smartphone, tablet, or PC in class. Let's just hope eduroam stays up...

Best regards,

Eric Laermans

PS: we might need a few additional chairs from neighbouring meeting rooms for the introduction course on Monday, February 12, as the official number of registered students for this course is 127 and the maximal capacity of the class room is only 100 students (but we can put a few additional chairs at the front). So, please don't be late... I don't expect similar issues for Tuesday's course at 8:30...

--

announcement.title: First exercise session on Monday, March 5 (+ theory about factorisation)
announcement.content:
Dear Madam, dear Sir,

Monday's (March 5, usual place and time) lecture will start with the theory about factorisation. We'll continue with the start of the first exercise session. It will deal with the complexity of the fundamental arithmetic and modular operations in both software and hardware. This exercise session will be continued on Monday, March 12.

Best regards,

Eric Laermans

announcement.title: Third exercise session on Monday, March 19
announcement.content:
Dear Madam, dear Sir,

As announced Monday, the third exercise session will take place on Monday, March 19 (usual place and time). It will deal with so-called strong primes and with the complexity of a few basic mathematical algorithms used in cryptography (which had originally been announced as the second part of the second exercise session).

Best regards,

Eric Laermans

announcement.title: IAESTE internships still available for computer science students
announcement.content:
Dear Madam, dear Sir,

I've been informed that a few IAESTE-internships are still available for computer science students . You can find some information about it in the powerpoint file IAESTE-COSC.pptx on Minerva (under Documents). More detailed information can be found at https://vtk.ugent.be/iaesteappl/internship (registration required). You can contact REDACTED if you want to apply for one of these open internships.

Best regards,

Eric Laermans
